content.question: Step 1: <math alttext="question mark " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>?</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> (slow) Step 2: <math alttext="N O 2 gas plus F gas produces N O 2 F gas " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo><mtext>F</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo></mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>F</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> (fast) Overall: <math alttext="2 N O 2 gas plus F 2 gas produces 2 N O 2 F gas " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mn>2</mn><mtext> NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>F</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo></mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>F</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> The overall reaction represented above is proposed to take place through two elementary steps. Which of the following statements about the chemical equation for step 1 and the rate law for the overall reaction is correct?

choices.label: The chemical equation for step 1 is <math alttext="N O 2 gas plus F 2 gas produces N O 2 F gas plus F gas " overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mrow> <msub> <mrow> <mtext>NO</mtext> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </msub> <mo>(</mo> <mi>g</mi> <mo>)</mo> <mrow> <mo>+</mo> </mrow> <mrow> <msub> <mrow> <mtext>F</mtext> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </msub> <mo>(</mo> <mi>g</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mrow> <mo>→</mo> <msub> <mrow> <mtext>NO</mtext> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </msub> <mtext>F</mtext> <mo>(</mo> <mi>g</mi> <mo>)</mo> <mo>+</mo> <mtext>F</mtext> <mo>(</mo> <mi>g</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> </mrow></mstyle> </math>, and the rate law for the overall reaction is <math alttext="rate equals k, times the molar concentration of N O 2, times the molar concentration of F 2 " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>r</mi><mi>a</mi><mi>t</mi><mi>e</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>]</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>F</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>]</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The chemical equation for step 1 is <math alttext="N O 2 gas plus F gas produces N O 2 F gas plus F 2 gas " overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mrow> <msub> <mrow> <mtext>NO</mtext> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </msub> <mo>(</mo> <mi>g</mi> <mo>)</mo> <mrow> <mo>+</mo> </mrow> <mrow> <mtext>F</mtext> <mo>(</mo> <mi>g</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mrow> <mo>→</mo> <msub> <mrow> <mtext>NO</mtext> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </msub> <mtext>F</mtext> <mo>(</mo> <mi>g</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mrow> <mo>+</mo> <msub> <mrow> <mtext>F</mtext> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </msub> <mo>(</mo> <mi>g</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> </mrow></mstyle> </math>, and the rate law for the overall reaction is <math alttext="rate equals k, times the molar concentration of N O 2, times the molar concentration of F " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>r</mi><mi>a</mi><mi>t</mi><mi>e</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>]</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>[F</mtext><mtext>]</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The chemical equation for step 1 is <math alttext="2 N O 2 gas plus F 2 gas produces 2 N O 2 F gas " overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> <mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"> </mspace> <mrow> <msub> <mrow> <mtext>NO</mtext> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </msub> <mo>(</mo> <mi>g</mi> <mo>)</mo> <mrow> <mo>+</mo> </mrow> <mrow> <msub> <mrow> <mtext>F</mtext> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </msub> <mo>(</mo> <mi>g</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mrow> <mo>→</mo> <msub> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> <mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"> </mspace> <mtext>NO</mtext> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </msub> <mtext>F</mtext> <mo>(</mo> <mi>g</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> </mrow></mstyle> </math>, and the rate law for the overall reaction is <math alttext="rate equals k, times the molar concentration of N O 2, times the molar concentration of F " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>r</mi><mi>a</mi><mi>t</mi><mi>e</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>]</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>[F</mtext><mtext>]</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The chemical equation for step 1 is <math alttext="3 N O 2 gas plus F 2 gas plus F gas produces 3 N O 2 F gas " overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mrow> <msub> <mrow> <mn>3</mn> <mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"> </mspace> <mtext>NO</mtext> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </msub> <mo>(</mo> <mi>g</mi> <mo>)</mo> <mrow> <mo>+</mo> </mrow> <mrow> <msub> <mrow> <mtext>F</mtext> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </msub> <mo>(</mo> <mi>g</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mrow> <mo>+</mo> <mtext>F</mtext> <mo>(</mo> <mi>g</mi> <mo>)</mo> <mo>→</mo> <msub> <mrow> <mn>3</mn> <mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"> </mspace> <mtext>NO</mtext> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </msub> <mtext>F</mtext> <mo>(</mo> <mi>g</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> </mrow></mstyle> </math>, and the rate law for the overall reaction is <math alttext="rate equals k, times the molar concentration of N O 2, squared, times the molar concentration of F 2 " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>r</mi><mi>a</mi><mi>t</mi><mi>e</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><msup><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>]</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>F</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>]</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: The chemical equation for step 1 is <math alttext="N O 2 gas plus F 2 gas produces N O 2 F gas plus F gas " overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mrow> <msub> <mrow> <mtext>NO</mtext> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </msub> <mo>(</mo> <mi>g</mi> <mo>)</mo> <mrow> <mo>+</mo> </mrow> <mrow> <msub> <mrow> <mtext>F</mtext> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </msub> <mo>(</mo> <mi>g</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mrow> <mo>→</mo> <msub> <mrow> <mtext>NO</mtext> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </msub> <mtext>F</mtext> <mo>(</mo> <mi>g</mi> <mo>)</mo> <mo>+</mo> <mtext>F</mtext> <mo>(</mo> <mi>g</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> </mrow></mstyle> </math>, and the rate law for the overall reaction is <math alttext="rate equals k, times the molar concentration of N O 2, times the molar concentration of F 2 " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>r</mi><mi>a</mi><mi>t</mi><mi>e</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>]</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>F</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>]</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>.

skill.text: 5.E: Determine a balanced chemical equation for a given chemical phenomenon.
